snippet: The explosion in Aleppo killed at least 10 people, and more than 500 have died during two weeks of bombardment of civilian targets by the Syrian government.
abstract: Explosion in Aleppo, Syria, is the latest in a series of attacks on civilian targets by the government of Pres Bashar al-Assad; government forces began to escalate their siege of Aleppo in mid-December, and international aid group Doctors Without Borders says that it counts more than 540 people killed as a result.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: The explosion in Aleppo killed at least 10 people, and more than 500 have died during two weeks of bombardment of civilian targets by the Syrian government.

headline.main: Shelling of Bus in Northern Syria Caps a Merciless Year
headline.print_headline: Shelling of Bus in Northern Syria Caps a Merciless Year
